DataElement.preferredName: Person Disease or Disorder Activity Restriction Assessment Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether a subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life by a person has identified an existing abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, limits or restricts normal activities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Disease or Disorder Activity Restriction Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life by a person that an existing abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, limits or restricts normal activities.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Activity Restriction Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The state of being active; any specific activity.:Anything that limits; a limitation.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.
